special_qualities.name: Quick Energy
special_qualities.description: Once per encounter, an Aleena can gain a temporary boost to quickness and reflexes. When this ability is activated as a swift action, an Aleena gains a +2 bonus on Dexterity-based skill checks and increases its speed to 8 squares. The energy lasts for a number of rounds equal to the Aleena's Constitution modifier (minimum 1 round). When the energy is expended, the Aleena moves -1 persistent step along the condition track. The penalties imposed by this condition persist until the Aleena takes at least 10 minutes to recuperate, during which time the creature can't engage in any strenuous activity.

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: Amanin do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at 1st level, even if their class normally grants those feats

special_qualities.name: Roll
special_qualities.description: When using the run action, Amanin may roll into a ball to move at greater speed. When rolling, Amanin take a â€“5 penalty on Perception checks, but their speed is doubled.

special_qualities.name: Mesmerize
special_qualities.description: As a standard action, you can make a special attack against the Will Defense of a single target, within 6 squares. The attack modifier is equal to your character level plus your CHA modifier. If the attack succeeds, the target loses its standard action for the next turn. If it fails, the target is immune to this effect for 24 hours. This is a mind-affecting effect.

special_qualities.name: Presence Sense
special_qualities.description: When making a Survival check to track a living creature, you gain a species bonus equal to the quarry's Force Point total

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Soup Drinking
special_qualities.description: As a swift action once/round, you can use your proboscii to drain energy from a grabbed target, moving the target -1 step on the condition track as a persistent condition and granting you bonus hit points equal to 5 + half your level. You can repeat this action each round until the target escapes the grab or is rendered unconscious. If the target survives the feeding attempt, the persistent condition is removed after the target rests for 8 hours.

special_qualities.name: Determination

The Arkanian offshoot must take the result of the second roll. A skill check is considered a failure only when the check fails to meet the minimum DC for any kind of success.

special_qualities.name: Memory Sharing
special_qualities.description: Caamasi can create strong, lasting memories and share them with others of their species through an inborn telepathy. Sharing a memory begins with taking a full-round action to initiate the link between two adjacent Caamasi; transferring a memory requires as much time as the events being recalled. The recipient of a memory must be willing to receive it. Experiencing memniiis not like receiving a photographic memory of those events, but rather a complete, immersive experience. Any character who receives a memnis from a Caamasi always gains favorable circumstances on Knowledge checks related to that memory. Force-using characters can also receive memnii from a Caamasi with a successful DC 15 Use the Force check, made as a reaction.

special_qualities.name: Pacifism
special_qualities.description: As a standard action, a Caamasi can make a Persuasion check against the Will Defense of a single target within line of sight. If the check is successful, the target moves -1 step along the condition track if it makes any attacks before the start of the Caamasi's next turn. The target must be able to hear and understand the Caamasi for this ability to have any effect, and any single target can be affected only once at any given time (meaning that multiple Caamasi may not use this ability on the same target at the same time). This is a mind-affecting effect.

special_qualities.name: Broadcast Telepath
special_qualities.description: Celegians can use the Telepathy application of the Use the Force skill untrained, even if they do not possess the Force Sensitivity feat. A Celegian automatically succeeds on this check to communicate with willing targets within 60 squares of it and in its line of sight.

special_qualities.name: Shapeshift
special_qualities.description: Clawdites are shapechangers and can alter their appearance at will. A Clawdite gains a +10 species bonus on Deception checks made to disguise appearance. Additionally, a Clawdite can disguise its appearance as a full-round action at no penalty.

special_qualities.description: Gains Dual Weapon Mastery as a bonus feat provided he or she meets the prerequisites of the feat (minimum Dexterity of 13 and a base attack bonus of + 1).

special_qualities.name: Extra Arms
special_qualities.description: Codru-Ji can hold up to four items or weapons at a time. This ability does not grant extra attacks; however, it does mean that a Codru-Ji can wield two two-handed weapons at a time.

special_qualities.name: Skilled Grappler
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to grab attacks

special_qualities.name: Illusory Form
special_qualities.description: A Croke can hide its true appearance behind an illusion. As a swift action, it can appear as a Small or Medium creature that can vary in appearance depending on who views it, and it can maintain this illusion indefinitely. The illusion has no effect on the Croke's statistics. A creature can pierce the illusion by making a Perception or Use the Force check against the Croke's Will Defense as a standard action, but only while the Croke is stunned or unconscious. The illusion otherwise looks and feels absolutely real.

special_qualities.description: You are immune to the effects of vacuum

special_qualities.description: Gains a +1 species bonus to Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.description: Gains a +1 species bonus to Will Defense.

special_qualities.name: Environmental Adaptation
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your Fortitude Defense against the effects of extreme heat, extreme cold and radiation

special_qualities.name: Fearsome Reputation
special_qualities.description: You can reroll Persuasion checks made to intimidate another, keeping the better result

special_qualities.name: Force Resistance
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your Fortitude and Will Defenses against any Use the Force checks

special_qualities.name: Partial Invisibility
special_qualities.description: When you are in shadowy illumination or darker conditions you are treated as having total concealment; you are fully visible and gain no concealment against opponents with darkvision

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Behavioral Inhibitors
special_qualities.description: Droids (except 4th-degree droids) cannot intentionally harm a sentient living being or knowingly allow a sentient living being to be harmed. Furthermore, all droids must follow orders given to them by their rightful owners, as long as those orders don't require the droid to harm a sentient living being. Droids with heuristic processors can sometimes violate these restrictions by creatively interpreting their behavioral inhibitions (see Processors, page 190).

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Ion Damage Vulnerability
special_qualities.description: As electronic constructs, droids are vulnerable to damage from ion weapons (see Ion Weapons, page 159). Generally, ion weapons have the same effect on droids that stun weapons have on living beings.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Maintenance
special_qualities.description: Droids do not sleep, eat, or breathe. However, they do need to enter shutdown mode and recharge for 1 hour after 100 hours of operation. If a droid fails to do so, it must make an Endurance check each hour (DC 10, + 1 per additional hour after the first) or move -1 persistent step along the condition track (see Conditions, page 148). This persistent condition can only be removed by the droid recharging for 1 hour.

special_qualities.name: Nonliving
special_qualities.description: A droid is immune to poison, disease, radiation, noncorrosive atmospheric hazards, vacuum, mind-affecting effects, stunning effects, and any other effect that works only on living targets. Droids have no connection to the Force and can't gain the Force Sensitivity feat or learn Force powers. Droids do not have a Constitution score, so they don't get bonus hit points for having a high Constitution, and they apply their Strength modifier to their Fortitude Defense. Unlike living beings, droids don't "die," but they can be disabled or destroyed. If a droid is reduced to 0 hit points, it is disabled and cannot be reactivated until it is repaired so that has at least 1 hit point. If the attack that reduced the droid to 0 hit points also exceeds the droid's damage threshold, the droid is destroyed instead. A destroyed droid cannot be repaired or salvaged.

special_qualities.name: Repair
special_qualities.description: Droids can regain lost hit points only through the use of the Mechanics skill (see page 68). A droid can use this skill to repair itself, but it takes a -5 penalty on its skill check.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Shut Down
special_qualities.description: A droid that is shut down can take no actions and is effectively unconscious. Shutting down a willing droid is a standard action. Shutting down an unwilling droid is more difficult, requiring that you to grab the droid (see Grab, page 152) and then make a Mechanics check (DC = droid's Will Defense) as a standard action while it's grabbed. You cannot shut down an unwilling droid with locked access unless it is disabled or otherwise helpless (see Locked Access, page 195).

special_qualities.name: Skills
special_qualities.description: Droids normally cannot use any skill untrained except for Acrobatics, Climb, Jump, and Perception. A droid with a heuristic processor ignores this limitation (see Processors, page 190).

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Systems
special_qualities.description: Droids can have many of their characteristics changed by installing or replacing existing systems (see Modifying Droids, page 197).

special_qualities.description: Droids can regain lost hit points only through the use of the Mechanics skill (see page 68). A droid can use this skill to repair itself, but it takes a -5 penalty on its skill check.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Shut Down
special_qualities.description: A droid that is shut down can take no actions and is effectively unconscious. Shutting down a willing droid is a standard action. Shutting down an unwilling droid is more difficult, requiring that you to grab the droid (see Grab, page 152) and then make a Mechanics check (DC = droid's Will Defense) as a standard action while it's grabbed. You cannot shut down an unwilling droid with locked access unless it is disabled or otherwise helpless (see Locked Access, page 195).

special_qualities.name: Skills
special_qualities.description: Droids normally cannot use any skill untrained except for Acrobatics, Climb, Jump, and Perception. A droid with a heuristic processor ignores this limitation (see Processors, page 190).

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Systems
special_qualities.description: Droids can have many of their characteristics changed by installing or replacing existing systems (see Modifying Droids, page 197).

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Behavioral Inhibitors
special_qualities.description: Droids (except 4th-degree droids) cannot intentionally harm a sentient living being or knowingly allow a sentient living being to be harmed. Furthermore, all droids must follow orders given to them by their rightful owners, as long as those orders don't require the droid to harm a sentient living being. Droids with heuristic processors can sometimes violate these restrictions by creatively interpreting their behavioral inhibitions (see Processors, page 190).

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Ion Damage Vulnerability
special_qualities.description: As electronic constructs, droids are vulnerable to damage from ion weapons (see Ion Weapons, page 159). Generally, ion weapons have the same effect on droids that stun weapons have on living beings.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Maintenance
special_qualities.description: Droids do not sleep, eat, or breathe. However, they do need to enter shutdown mode and recharge for 1 hour after 100 hours of operation. If a droid fails to do so, it must make an Endurance check each hour (DC 10, + 1 per additional hour after the first) or move -1 persistent step along the condition track (see Conditions, page 148). This persistent condition can only be removed by the droid recharging for 1 hour.

special_qualities.name: Nonliving
special_qualities.description: A droid is immune to poison, disease, radiation, noncorrosive atmospheric hazards, vacuum, mind-affecting effects, stunning effects, and any other effect that works only on living targets. Droids have no connection to the Force and can't gain the Force Sensitivity feat or learn Force powers. If the attack that reduced the droid to 0 hit points also exceeds the droid's damage threshold, the droid is destroyed instead. A destroyed droid cannot be repaired or salvaged.

special_qualities.name: Repair
special_qualities.description: Droids can regain lost hit points only through the use of the Mechanics skill (see page 68). A droid can use this skill to repair itself, but it takes a -5 penalty on its skill check.

special_qualities.name: Athletic
special_qualities.description: A Dug can reroll any Climb or Jump check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted, even if it is worse. In addition, a Dug can take 10 on Climb and Jump checks even when distracted or threatened.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: A Dug that has Acrobatics as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Acrobatics) as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Dug Agility
special_qualities.description: The Dugs' natural environment makes them extremely agile. Dugs may reroll any Climb check or Jump check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted, even if it is worse.

special_qualities.name: Lightning Reflexes
special_qualities.description: Dugs gain a +2 species bonus to their Reflex Defense, accounting for their uncanny ability to avoid danger.

special_qualities.name: Athletic
special_qualities.description: A Dug can reroll any Climb or Jump check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted, even if it is worse. In addition, a Dug can take 10 on Climb and Jump checks even when distracted or threatened.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: A Dug that has Acrobatics as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Acrobatics) as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Dug Agility
special_qualities.description: The Dugs' natural environment makes them extremely agile. Dugs may reroll any Climb check or Jump check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted, even if it is worse.

special_qualities.name: Lightning Reflexes
special_qualities.description: Dugs gain a +2 species bonus to their Reflex Defense, accounting for their uncanny ability to avoid danger.

special_qualities.name: Expert Pilot
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Pilot check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll)

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Improved Damage Threshold as a bonus feat if your have a CON 13 or better

special_qualities.name: Iron Will
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Will Defense

special_qualities.name: Unsettling
special_qualities.description: Once per encounter, when an Ebruchi successfully uses the Persuasion skill to intimidate a target, the Ebruchi can move the target -1 step on the condition track instead of applying one of the standard intimidation effects. The target must be within 6 squares of the Ebruchi, and the effect lasts until the end of the encounter. This is a mind-affecting effect.

special_qualities.name: Impose Order
special_qualities.description: Once per encounter, an Elomin can spend a swift action to allow each ally within 12 squares to move up to half that ally's speed as a reaction. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

special_qualities.name: Logical Mind
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to Will Defense against mind-affecting effects

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Survival) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Survival skill

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at first level, even if your class normally grants them

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Scent
special_qualities.description: At close range (within 10 squares), you ignore concealment and cover for purposes of Perception checks, and you take no penalty from poor visibility when tracking

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Hold Breath
special_qualities.description: You can hold your breath for a number of rounds equal to 25 x your CON score before having to make Endurance checks to hold your breath

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Pheromone Acclimation
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your Fortitude Defense against the pheromones of other Falleen

special_qualities.name: Pheromones
special_qualities.description: As a standard action, you can make a special attack vs adjacent creature; the attack bonus = your character level + your CHA bonus; if the attack equals or exceeds the target's Fortitude Defense, the target moves -1 step on the condition track. If you fail, target is immune for 24h. If target reaches -5 CT, instead of falling unconscious, it becomes friendly. Pheromones function as an inhaled poison. Any creature holding its breath is unaffected (see the Endurance skill description on page 66 of the Saga Edition core rulebook). A creature can be affected by Falleen pheromones only once per round. Multiple exposures to pheromones from different Falleen in the same round produce no additional effects. A hostile creature cannot be targeted by this effect.

special_qualities.name: Brutal
special_qualities.description: Once per encounter, after making a successful melee attack, a Feeorin may treat its opponents damage threshold as though it were 5 points lower when determining the result of the attack.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Great Fortitude

special_qualities.name: Force Sight
special_qualities.description: Although blind, Miraluka can "see" by using the Force. They act normally without taking any penalties for blindness when in the presence of living creatures or life of any kind. This trait enables them to make Perception checks, and read and write as a sighted person. They can ignore the effect of darkness as if they had darkvision. Miraluka cannot, however, detect creatures that are "invisible" to the Force such as the Yuuzhan Vong and the ysalamiri. These creatures have total concealment from Miraluka, as do creatures in areas that dampen or suppress the Force. Additionally, the Miraluka ignores all penalties to Perception checks from cover and concealment (but not total cover or total concealment). Miraluka do not increase the DC of Use the Force checks made to Sense Surroundings against targets with total cover.

Rakata reduce the penalty for not being proficient in a weapon from -5 to -2 and reduce the armor check penalty for armor they are not proficient in by one step (-5 for heavy armor, -2 for medium armor, and no penalty for light armor) All other penalties for not being proficient still apply. A Ryn can also throw his voice or project sounds from his musical beak out to a range of 10 squares. As a swift action, a Ryn can use ventriloquism to create a diversion to hide (see the Deception skill description on page 66 of the Saga Edition core rulebook).

special_qualities.name: Droid Shell
special_qualities.description: Shards must inhabit droid bodies to travel and function in the galaxy at large. In this form, they gain the following traits. -Shards must undergo maintenance as per a droid. -Shards are immune to poison, disease, radiation, noncorrosive atmospheric hazards, and vacuum. They can regain hit points only through the Repair Droid application of the Mechanics skill. They do not benefit from natural healing unless they have the Force Repair talent. -Shards are considered cybernetic creatures for the purposes of being damaged by ion weapons. -Shards can make use of droid systems and accessories, subject to some limitations. Shards can have the following droid accessories: appendages, armor, communications devices, internal storage, sensors, and translator units. Shard bodies have a cost modifier of x1.

species_list.description_general: The Tof were a green-skinned humanoid species from the planets Tof and Nagai, located beyond the Galactic Rim. They were known for their extreme xenophobia, militarism, and desire for conquest, engaging in a protracted war with the Nagai. Tof society was hierarchical and driven by a belief in their own superiority. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Togorian

special_qualities.name: Feline Reflexes
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 species bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Physically Intimidating
special_qualities.description: You use your STR bonus instead of your CHA bonus for Persuasion checks made to intimidate others.

species_list.description_general: Togorians are a large, feline humanoid species from the planet Togoria. They are known for their impressive strength, hunting prowess, and a culture that values honor and martial skill. Togorians possess retractable claws, sharp teeth, and a cat-like agility despite their size. Their society is often tribal, with a deep respect for tradition and warrior codes. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Togruta

special_qualities.name: Pack Hunter
special_qualities.description: You deal an extra 2 points of damage on melee attacks against opponents you flank.

special_qualities.name: Sneaky
special_qualities.description: You can choose to reroll any Stealth check to sneak, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Spatial Awareness
special_qualities.description: You ignore all cover and concealment when making Perception checks to notice targets within 10 squares.

species_list.description_general: Togruta are a sentient humanoid species from the planet Shili, known for their colorful skin patterns, large head-tails called lekku, and montrals (hollow horns) that grant a form of passive echolocation. They are often skilled hunters and warriors, with a strong connection to their community and natural environment. Togruta culture values unity and self-sufficiency. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Toydarian

special_qualities.name: Force Resistance (Mind-Affecting)
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your Will Defense against any Use the Force checks with the mind-affecting descriptor.

species_list.description_general: Toydarians are a winged humanoid species from Toydaria, known for their resistance to Force-based mental influence and their shrewd business acumen. They possess small, pudgy bodies, snouts, and leathery wings that allow them to hover. Toydarians are often found as merchants and traders, and their unique physiology makes them immune to many forms of mind manipulation. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Trandoshan

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Toughness as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Limb Regeneration
special_qualities.description: You can regrow a lost limb in 1d10 days.

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense.

species_list.description_general: Trandoshans are a large, saurian humanoid species from Trandosha (or Dosha), known for their exceptional strength, regenerative abilities, and a culture centered around hunting (particularly Wookiees) to appease their goddess, the Scorekeeper. They possess tough, scaly hides, clawed hands, and keen senses, including darkvision. Trandoshans are often found as bounty hunters, mercenaries, and slavers. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Trianii

special_qualities.name: Acrobatic Prowess
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Acrobatics check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage.

special_qualities.name: Prehensile Tail
special_qualities.description: can effectively hold (but not wield) a Small or smaller item with its tail. When holding a Medium or larger item with its tail, encumbered and considered to be carrying a heavy load.

species_list.description_general: The Trianii are a feline humanoid species known for their agility, retractable claws, and long, prehensile tails. They hail from the Trian system and have a strong warrior tradition, organized into clans and ranger cadres. Trianii value honor, skill, and self-reliance, and are often found as explorers, scouts, or mercenaries. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Tusken Raider

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Stealth or Survival)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Stealth or Survival check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.description_general: Tusken Raiders, or Sand People, are a nomadic and aggressive sentient species native to the desert planet Tatooine. They are known for their distinctive full-body wrappings and masks, their use of Banthas as mounts, and their fierce territoriality. Tusken culture is tribal and deeply intertwined with survival in the harsh desert environment. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Twi'lek

special_qualities.name: Deceptive
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Deception check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Great Fortitude
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Fortitude Defense.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

species_list.description_general: Twi'leks are a humanoid species originating from the planet Ryloth, easily recognizable by their twin head-tails called lekku, which are prehensile sensory organs. They come in a variety of skin colors and are known for their grace, cunning, and adaptability. Twi'lek culture is diverse, and they are found in many roles across the galaxy, from dancers and diplomats to smugglers and freedom fighters. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Ubese

special_qualities.name: Aggressive
special_qualities.description: If an Ubese character hits with a charge attack, the +2 bonus on attack rolls against the target persists for the duration of the encounter.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Perception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Perception skill.

special_qualities.name: Special Equipment (Environmental Suit and Breath Mask Requirement)
special_qualities.description: Ubese cannot tolerate the atmospheres of other worlds and must rely on breath masks to survive. Without a breath mask, an Ubese begins to suffocate. When not on their homeworld, Ubese wear environmental suits to stave of the hazards found on other planets as well as to hide their appearance. An environmental suit functions as a combat jumpsuit that also grants a +2 equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense. The suit also includes a voice modulator to emulate the voice of a male or female or to mask the Ubese's gender. An Ubese environmental suit with breath mask and voice modulator costs 2,000 credits, and a year's supply of breathing filters cost 200 credits (50 credits on Ubese). Ubese characters begin with these items at no cost.

effects.details: Functions as combat jumpsuit, grants +2 equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense, includes voice modulator.
effects.starting_equipment_note: Begins play with these items at no cost.

special_qualities.name: Survival Instinct
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Survival check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.description_general: The Ubese are a humanoid species known for their nomadic warrior culture and their distinctive environmental suits and breath masks, which they wear due to their inability to tolerate most standard atmospheres. They are often secretive and xenophobic, with a reputation for being skilled mercenaries and assassins. Their homeworld, Uba IV, was environmentally devastated. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Ugnaught
species_list.description_general: Ugnaughts are a diminutive porcine humanoid species known for their hard work, technical skills, and stubbornness. They are often found in industrial settings, particularly in mining and manufacturing, and are skilled mechanics and engineers. Ugnaught society is communal, and they are native to Gentes, but many were enslaved and dispersed throughout the galaxy. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]
species_list.notes_for_processing: Original entry was 'Ugnaught (best guess)', retaining name as 'Ugnaught'.

species_list.name: Ugor

special_qualities.name: Amorphous Nature
special_qualities.description: As a full-round action, an Ugor can raise or lower any physical ability by a maximum of 5 points, but each point must be transferred from another similar ability (such as Str, Dex, and Con). Abilities cannot be altered more than 5 points above or below the Ugorâ€™s original scores. Bonuses and penalties (to skills, defenses, attacks, and so on) have to be adjusted accordingly.

effects.effect_description: Can reallocate points between STR, DEX, CON. Max change per ability is +/- 5 from original score. Total points remain constant among these three. Derived stats must be adjusted.

species_list.description_general: The Ugor are an amorphous, shape-shifting species capable of altering their physical forms. This unique physiology allows them to adapt their physical abilities by reallocating points between Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution. They are often considered mysterious and their true nature can be difficult to ascertain. [Web Source: Based on common descriptions of amorphous species and provided traits.]
species_list.notes_for_processing: Original entry was 'Ugor (best guess)', retaining name as 'Ugor'.

species_list.name: Umbaran

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Persuasion skill.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Light Sensitivity
special_qualities.description: If you are exposed to bright light (such as sunlight), you're blinded for 1 round.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: This is in addition to Darkvision, likely meaning they still function better in dim light than complete darkness compared to species with only Darkvision, or it's redundant if Darkvision covers all low-light scenarios.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Persuasion)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Persuasion check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Stealthy
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Stealth check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.description_general: Umbarans are a pale-skinned, near-Human species from the shadowy planet Umbara, known for their ability to see in ultraviolet spectra and their often manipulative and subtle nature. They possess a hierarchical society and are skilled in espionage and political intrigue. Umbarans are typically sensitive to bright light but possess excellent darkvision and low-light vision. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Umbaran

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Persuasion skill.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision

[Web Source: Wookieepedia - Note: General description for Umbarans; specific traits from C source should be prioritized if different.]

species_list.name: Utai

special_qualities.name: Animal Handler
special_qualities.description: The Utai are naturally gifted when it comes to dealing with beasts and wild creatures. An Utai can choose to reroll any Ride check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted even if it is worse. Additionally, an Utai can make Persuasion checks to change the attitude of an undomesticated creature that has an Intelligence of 2 or lower.

special_qualities.name: Cooperative
special_qualities.description: You automatically succeed when attempting to aid another on a skill check, as long as the target is adjacent to and can hear and understand you.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

species_list.description_general: The Utai are a diminutive humanoid species native to the sinkhole world of Utapau, coexisting with the taller Pau'ans. They are characterized by their pale skin, large eyes, and small stature, serving primarily as laborers and animal handlers. Utai are known for their gentle nature, cooperative spirit, and innate skill with animals. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Vagaari

special_qualities.name: Bioknowledge
special_qualities.description: Vagaari have great working knowledge of biology throughout their sphere of influence in the Unknown Regions. They can reroll any Knowledge (life sciences) or Treat Injury check but must take the second result, even if it is worse.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Deception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Deception skill.

special_qualities.name: Frightening Visage
special_qualities.description: When using the Persuasion skill to intimidate, a Vagaari clad in traditional masks and garments can reroll a failed Persuasion check and take the better result. The Vagaari is considered trained in the Persuasion skill for this action.

species_list.description_general: The Vagaari are a species of slavers and pirates from the Unknown Regions, known for their distinctive skull-like masks and their use of slave collars to control their captives. They are often depicted as cruel and expansionist, with a culture that values dominance and conquest. Vagaari possess a good working knowledge of biology, likely for a mix of medical and coercive purposes. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Vahla

special_qualities.name: Cartilaginous Skeleton
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Acrobatics check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Dark Side Stigma
special_qualities.description: You must spend two Force Points to reduce your Dark Side Score by 1.

special_qualities.name: Force Sensitivity
special_qualities.description: You gain Force Sensitivity as a bonus feat.

species_list.description_general: The Vahla are a near-Human species with a strong natural connection to the Force, though this connection is often tinged with a predisposition or stigma towards the dark side. They possess a cartilaginous skeleton, granting them unusual flexibility. Their culture and history are often intertwined with their unique Force sensitivities. [Web Source: Wookieepedia, based on general descriptions of Force-sensitive species with dark side inclinations.]

species_list.name: Verpine

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Mechanics) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Mechanics skill.

special_qualities.name: Heightened Awareness
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Perception check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Verpine Communication
special_qualities.description: You can mentally communicate with any Verpine within a 1 kilometre radius.

species_list.description_general: Verpine are an insectoid species from the Roche asteroid field, renowned for their exceptional technological skills and innate understanding of mechanics. They possess large, black eyes, slender bodies, and the ability to communicate with each other via radio waves. Verpine society is communal and highly focused on engineering and innovation. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Vultan

special_qualities.name: Bonus Trained Skill
special_qualities.description: You choose one additional trained skill.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (one Knowledge skill) as a bonus feat if you are trained in one or more Knowledge skills.

species_list.description_general: The Vultan are a sentient species known for their intellectual capabilities and often scholarly pursuits. They tend to value knowledge and an analytical approach to problems. Their specific physical characteristics and homeworld are less prominent in galactic records, but their mental acuity is a defining trait. [Web Source: Based on provided stats and common Star Wars species archetypes focusing on intelligence.]

species_list.name: Vurk

special_qualities.name: Breathe Underwater
special_qualities.description: You cannot drown in water.

special_qualities.name: Expert Swimmer
special_qualities.description: You can choose to reroll any Swim check, but you must accept the second result, and you can take 10 on Swim checks even when distracted or threatened.

special_qualities.name: Nomads
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Survival check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Placid
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter as a free action you can remove one fear effect currently affecting you.

species_list.description_general: Vurk are a saurian amphibious species from the planet Sembla, known for their nomadic lifestyle and generally placid, though sometimes stubborn, nature. They possess tall, crested heads and tough hides. Vurk society is migratory, following herd animals across their homeworld's savannas and swamps, and they are skilled swimmers. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Weequay

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Endurance) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Endurance skill.

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Pheromones (Communication)
special_qualities.description: Weequay communicate silently with other members of their tribe by emitting complex pheromones. This form of communication has a maximum range of 20 squares. Species with the scent ability can detect Weequay pheromones by smell, but this does not allow them to understand what the Weequay are communicating.

effects.notes: Species with scent can detect, but not understand.

species_list.description_general: Weequays are a humanoid species from the desert planet Sriluur, known for their tough, leathery skin and their pheromonal communication abilities with other Weequays of the same clan. Their culture is deeply tied to their worship of a moon god, Quay. Weequays are often seen as stoic and resilient, frequently employed as mercenaries, pirates, or bodyguards, particularly by the Hutts. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Whiphid

special_qualities.name: Insulating Fur
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to Fortitude Defense to resist extreme cold.

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage.

special_qualities.name: Scent
special_qualities.description: At close range (within 10 squares), you ignore concealment and cover for purposes of Perception checks, and you take no penalty from poor visibility when tracking.

species_list.description_general: Whiphids are large, powerfully built, furry carnivores from the icy planet Toola. They are known for their great strength, resilience to cold, natural claws, and keen sense of smell. Whiphid society is tribal, with a strong emphasis on hunting and survival in their harsh native environment. They are often sought after as big game hunters, mercenaries, or enforcers. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Wookiee

special_qualities.name: Extraordinary Recuperation
special_qualities.description: A Wookiee regains hit points at double the normal rate (see Natural Healing, page 148).

special_qualities.name: Rage
special_qualities.description: Once/day you can fly into a rage as a swift action, temporarily gaining +2 rage bonus to melee attack rolls and damage rolls, but unable to use skills requiring concentration and patience; lasts 5 + Constitution rounds, and moves character -1 persistent step along the condition track until 10 minutes of relaxed recuperation have passed.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Climb and Intimidation)
special_qualities.description: You may choose to take 10 on Climb checks even when distracted or threatened; you may choose to reroll any Persuasion check made to intimidate other, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Weapon Familiarity (Bowcasters)
special_qualities.description: You treat bowcasters as rifles instead of exotic weapons.

species_list.description_general: Wookiees are a tall, powerfully built species of hirsute humanoids from the forest planet Kashyyyk. They are renowned for their immense strength, loyalty, fierce tempers, and mastery of technology that complements their natural surroundings. Wookiee culture values honor, courage, and life debts. They are easily recognizable by their roars and their use of bowcasters. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Wroonian

special_qualities.name: Free Spirit
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Will Defense.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Persuasion)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll Persuasion checks, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.description_general: Wroonians are a blue-skinned, near-Human species from the planet Wroona in the Inner Rim. They are known for their free-spirited nature, adaptability, and often a talent for persuasion and negotiation. Wroonian culture values independence and exploration, and they are commonly found throughout the galaxy as traders, pilots, and adventurers. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Yarkora

special_qualities.name: Confusion
special_qualities.description: As a defense mechanism, all Yarkora can use a combination of motions and sounds to distract and deter potential enemies. Once per encounter as a standard action, a Yarkora can make a Deception check against the Will Defense of all targets within 6 squares. If the Deception check result equals or exceeds a target's Will Defense, that target does not threaten any squares until the end of the Yarkora's next turn. This is a mind-affecting effect.

special_qualities.name: Deceptive
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Deception check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Streetwise (Gather Information Class Skill)
special_qualities.description: You have Gather Information as a class skill.

species_list.description_general: Yarkora are large, powerfully built humanoids with thick gray hides and snouted faces, hailing from a forgotten world. They are known for their deceptive abilities and a unique defense mechanism involving confusing motions and sounds to deter enemies. Their culture often emphasizes cunning and social manipulation. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Yevetha

special_qualities.name: Mechanical Aptitude
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter you can treat any single Mechanics check as if the die roll is a natural 20.

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage.

special_qualities.name: Xenophobia
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to Will Defense against Persuasion checks made to improve your attitude made by non-Yevetha.

species_list.description_general: The Yevetha are a xenophobic and technologically adept humanoid species from N'zoth in the Koornacht Cluster. They possess gaunt frames, retractable dewclaws, and a rigid, hierarchical society that views other species with disdain. Yevetha are known for their biological ship technology and their history of aggressive expansionism and enslavement of other races. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Yuuzhan Vong

special_qualities.name: Force Immunity
special_qualities.description: Yuuzhan Vong can't take the Force Sensitivity feat, can't make Use the Force checks, and never gain Force Points. In addition, they are immune to any Force effect that targets Will Defense (including Force powers and aspects of the Use the Force skill).

effects.details: Cannot take Force Sensitivity feat, make Use the Force checks, or gain Force Points. Immune to Force effects targeting Will Defense.

special_qualities.name: Technophobic
special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats, even if your class normally grants them.

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Weapon Familiarity (Amphistaffs)
special_qualities.description: You treat amphistaffs as simple weapons instead of exotic weapons.

species_list.description_general: The Yuuzhan Vong are a sentient species from another galaxy, known for their fanatical religious beliefs, organic biotechnology, and extreme intolerance for mechanical technology. They are physically imposing, with scarred and tattooed bodies, and are immune to direct Force manipulation. Their invasion of the galaxy caused widespread devastation during the Yuuzhan Vong War. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Yuuzhan Vong

special_qualities.name: Force Immunity
special_qualities.description: Yuuzhan Vong can't take the Force Sensitivity feat, can't make Use the Force checks, and never gain Force Points. In addition, they are immune to any Force effect that targets Will Defense (including Force powers and aspects of the Use the Force skill).

effects.details: Cannot take Force Sensitivity feat, make Use the Force checks, or gain Force Points. Immune to Force effects targeting Will Defense.

special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats, even if your class normally grants them.

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.description: You treat amphistaffs as simple weapons instead of exotic weapons.

They are physically imposing, with scarred and tattooed bodies, and are immune to direct Force manipulation. Their invasion of the galaxy caused widespread devastation during the Yuuzhan Vong War. [Web Source: Wookieepedia - Note: General description for Yuuzhan Vong; specific traits from CR source should be prioritized if different.]

species_list.name: Yuzzem

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws or teeth, dealing 1d8 slashing or piercing damage respectively.

special_qualities.name: Physically Intimidating
special_qualities.description: You use your STR bonus instead of your CHA bonus for Persuasion checks made to intimidate others.

special_qualities.name: Scent
special_qualities.description: At close range (within 10 squares), you ignore concealment and cover for purposes of Perception checks, and you take no penalty from poor visibility when tracking.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Climb)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll Climb checks, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.description_general: Yuzzem are large, immensely strong, furry humanoids known for their short tempers and great loyalty. They possess sharp claws and teeth, and a keen sense of smell. While sometimes mistaken for Wookiees due to their size and fur, Yuzzem have distinct features and cultural traits. They are often found in physically demanding roles or as fierce protectors. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Zabrak

special_qualities.name: Heightened Awareness
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Perception check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Superior Defenses
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 species bonus to all of your Defenses.

species_list.description_general: Zabrak, also known as Iridonians when referring to those from their homeworld Iridonia, are a near-Human species known for their prominent cranial horns and often elaborate facial tattoos signifying rites of passage or personal achievements. They possess a strong sense of self-determination, willpower, and are known for their martial prowess and resilience. Zabrak are found throughout the galaxy and have a reputation for being independent and sometimes aggressive. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Zeltron

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: A Zeltron that has Persuasion as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Empathy
special_qualities.description: You add your CHA bonus to Perception checks made to sense deception or sense influence.

special_qualities.name: Intuitive Initiative
special_qualities.description: Zeltrons are known for their quick reactions. A Zeltron may choose to reroll any Initiative check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted, even if it is worse.

special_qualities.name: Pheromones (Persuasion)
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus on Persuasion checks made to change the attitudes of non-Zeltrons.

special_qualities.name: Zeltron Empathy
special_qualities.description: Zeltrons are naturally empathic. As a free action, a Zeltron may make a Perception check opposed by a target's Will Defense. If successful, the Zeltron may discover the target's attitude toward him or her, as well as the target's general emotional state. The target cannot detect this check.

species_list.description_general: Zeltrons are a near-Human species from the planet Zeltros, renowned for their vibrant pink or red skin, their empathic abilities, and their culture centered around pleasure, art, and interpersonal connection. They can project and perceive emotions, often using this to create harmonious environments or influence others. Zeltrons are generally fun-loving, charismatic, and value happiness and positive experiences. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Zeltron

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: A Zeltron that has Persuasion as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Empathy
special_qualities.description: You add your CHA bonus to Perception checks made to sense deception or sense influence.

special_qualities.name: Intuitive Initiative
special_qualities.description: Zeltrons are known for their quick reactions. A Zeltron may choose to reroll any Initiative check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted, even if it is worse.

special_qualities.name: Pheromones (Persuasion)
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus on Persuasion checks made to change the attitudes of non-Zeltrons.

special_qualities.name: Zeltron Empathy

If successful, the Zeltron may discover the target's attitude toward him or her, as well as the target's general emotional state. The target cannot detect this check.

species_list.description_general: Zeltrons are a near-Human species from the planet Zeltros, renowned for their vibrant pink or red skin, their empathic abilities, and their culture centered around pleasure, art, and interpersonal connection. They can project and perceive emotions, often using this to create harmonious environments or influence others. Zeltrons are generally fun-loving, charismatic, and value happiness and positive experiences. special_qualities.description: You gain Martial Arts 1 as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Will Defense.

special_qualities.name: Strength of Conviction
special_qualities.description: You can use your CHA bonus in place of your WIS bonus when calculating Will Defense.

species_list.description_general: Zygerrians are a feline humanoid species from the planet Zygerria, known for their historical empire built on slavery and their formidable martial prowess. They possess retractable claws, agile bodies, and a culture that values strength, cunning, and dominance. Zygerrians are often depicted with striped fur and a proud, sometimes arrogant, demeanor. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]
